results.title: Get out and live
results.creator_credit: Col Lewis and Cameracraft Film Productions
results.brief_description:
This 1972 film, produced for the Main Roads Department, Brisbane, describes the establishment of an emergency control organisation within the department, and shows the training and implementation of an emergency evacuation of 1,500 people from the 14 storey office building.

Produced by Cameracraft Film Productions.

The colour is faded throughout the film and there are jumps in the soundtrack throughout due to missing frames.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: First aid
results.brief_description: A film of historic interest: an official training film produced for the War department in three parts. Part 1: emergency treatment of bleeding wounds, including self-administration. Covers the arterial system, pressure points and application of tournequets. Part 2: emergency treatment of broken bones. Part 3: covers methods of removing the wounded.

results.title: A Demonstration of basic film techniques
results.brief_description: Designed to serve as a practical aid for teachers presenting a course in film appreciation. Experience has shown that one of the first barriers to be broken down in such a course is the students’ ignorance of the fact that a film is MADE, that it is the result of conscious decision by the film maker. Teachers may use it to demonstrate the more common shots in film making. They may use it to establish the idea of film editing - the joining together of separate shots into a meaningful unit. The film’s deficiencies and faults should serve as valuable teaching points during discussion after the film.

results.title: David and Jennifer Learn Their Kerb Drill
results.creator_credit: Rhonda Small, John Martin-Jones, Australian Road Safety Council and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: David and Jennifer are sent on messages to a shop across a busy street. Their mother carefully explains the meaning of the traffic lights. They sing a safety song to remember the newly learnt rules.

results.title: The Country Roads Board gazette No. 10
results.brief_description: Progress report on work of the Country Roads Board; rebuilding the Warrigal Road and the Nepean Highway intersection; new road bridge across the Maribyrnong River at Footscray; construction of a new Air Force air strip; digging storm water drains in the metropolitan areas; maintenance and building of country roads and bridges.

results.title: The Blowfly menace
results.creator_credit: A. C. McKay BVSc and Australian Wool Corporation
results.brief_description: For farmers and graziers this study of the life-cycle of the green blowfly and other flies associated with blowfly strike in sheep, and demonstrations of various methods of control, should prove both useful and interesting.

results.title: Before production begins
results.brief_description: The story of the birth of a new Holden car, from an artist’s conception, through the modelling of small and full scale models, to the making of the first prototype model. From the hundreds of scale drawings, skilled craftsmen create by hand, the hundreds of engine and body components of the prototype. Laboratory and road tests of components and the completed prototype ensue that every section of the car conforms to rigid engineering specifications. Only after all this preliminary work can mass production begin on a new model Holden car.

results.title: My nightmare has just begun
results.creator_credit: Linda Lord, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Linda Lord recounts the day the Gippsland bushfires came to her home. Despite undergoing fire training and preparation, when the fire front approached, there was no time to think. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Latrobe City and Arts Victoria.

results.title: Grateful angels
results.creator_credit: Roslyn Evans, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Grateful and Angels are Roslyn Evans’ treasured cows that she nearly lost in the Gippsland bushfires. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Latrobe City and Arts Victoria.

results.title: Community under siege
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Davies, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In her role as a co-ordinator of the community centre, Suzanne Davies recounts the devastation that the Gippsland bushfires caused her community. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Latrobe City and Arts Victoria.
